analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Subhasutta
analyzed: subhasutta
translated: The Good Person

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena subho māṇavo todeyyaputto sāvatthiyaṁ paṭivasati aññatarassa gahapatissa nivesane kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya putto sāvatthiyam paṭivasati aññatarassa gahapatissa nivesane kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: Now on that occasion the brahmin student Subha, Todeyya’s son, was dwelling at Sāvatthī because of some business or other.

original: Atha kho subho māṇavo todeyyaputto yassa gahapatissa nivesane paṭivasati taṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya puttaḥ yassa gahapatissa nivesane paṭivasati tam gahapatim etat avoca
translated: Then the brahmin student Subha approached that householder and said to him:

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, gahapati:
analyzed: sutam mā ita gahapati
translated: “Householder, I have heard it said:

original: ‘avivittā sāvatthī arahantehī’ti.
analyzed: a vivittā sāvatthī
translated: ‘Sāvatthī is not crowded with brahmins and contemplatives;🔽there is plenty of almsfood; it is easy to live by collecting scraps;

original: Kaṁ nu khvajja samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā payirupāseyyāmā”ti?
analyzed: kam nu khvajja samaṇam vā brāhmaṇam vā payis upāseyyāma ati
translated: and there are few flies and mosquitoes.’

original: “Ayaṁ, bhante, bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: bhante bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: “Venerable sir, the Blessed One is dwelling at Sāvatthī.

original: Taṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ payirupāsassū”ti.
analyzed: ta bhante bhagavantam payis upāsassu iti
translated: Please visit the Blessed One.”

original: Atha kho subho māṇavo todeyyaputto tassa gahapatissa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya putto tassa gahapatissa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then Subha, the young brāhmaṇa of the Todeyya clan, having answered in the affirmative to that householder, approached the Fortunate One, and after approaching, he exchanged greetings with the Fortunate One.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho subho māṇavo todeyyaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: After exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side, while sitting on one side the young brāhmaṇa Subha, the Todeyya clan, said this to the Fortunate One:

original: “brāhmaṇā, bho gotama, evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ bho gotama
translated: “The brāhmaṇas, reverend Gotama, say this:

original: ‘gahaṭṭho ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ, na pabbajito ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalan’ti.
analyzed: gahaṭṭhaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti ñāyam dhammam kusala na pabbajitaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti ñāyam dhammam kusalanti
translated: ‘The householder is successful in regard to the true Dhamma and Discipline, not the one who has gone forth (as a monk).’

original: Idha bhavaṁ gotamo kimāhā”ti?
analyzed: bhavam gotamaḥ kim āha ati
translated: What does Master Gotama say about this?”

original: “Vibhajjavādo kho ahamettha, māṇava;
analyzed: vibhajja vādaḥ kho aham ettha māṇava
translated: “I am one who analyses this, young man,

original: nāhamettha ekaṁsavādo.
analyzed: na aham ettha eka savādaḥ
translated: I am not one who speaks in general terms about this.

original: Gihissa vāhaṁ, māṇava, pabbajitassa vā micchāpaṭipattiṁ na vaṇṇemi.
analyzed: gihissa vā āha māṇava pabbajitassa vā micchā paṭipattim na vaṇṇemi
translated: I do not praise the wrong practice of one who is a householder, or of one who has gone forth (as a monk).

original: Gihī vā hi, māṇava, pabbajito vā micchāpaṭipanno micchāpaṭipattādhikaraṇahetu na ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
analyzed: gihī vā hi māṇava pabbajitaḥ vā micchā paṭipannaḥ micchā paṭipatta adhikaraṇa hetu na ārādhakaḥ hoti ñāyam dhammam kusala
translated: For, young man, whether it is a householder, or one who has gone forth (as a monk), one who is a wrong practitioner, because of wrong practice, is not successful in regard to the true Dhamma and Discipline.

original: Gihissa vāhaṁ, māṇava, pabbajitassa vā sammāpaṭipattiṁ vaṇṇemi.
analyzed: gihissa vā āha māṇava pabbajitassa vā sammā paṭipattim vaṇṇemi
translated: I praise the right practice of one who is a householder or one who has gone forth.

original: Gihī vā hi, māṇava, pabbajito vā sammāpaṭipanno sammāpaṭipattādhikaraṇahetu ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalan”ti.
analyzed: gihī vā hi māṇava pabbajitaḥ vā sammāpaṭipanno sammāpaṭipatta adhikaraṇa hetu ārādhakaḥ hoti ñāyam dhammam kusalanti
translated: For whether it is a householder or one who has gone forth, it is the one who practices rightly who, because of that right practice, succeeds in attaining the true way, the Dhamma that is wholesome.”

original: “Brāhmaṇā, bho gotama, evamāhaṁsu:🔽‘mahaṭṭhamidaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ gharāvāsakammaṭṭhānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti;
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ bho gotama  mahaṭṭham idam mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambham ghara āvāsa kammaṭṭhānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: “Master Gotama, the brahmins say this:🔽‘The performance of one’s duties in the household life is a great thing, with great fruit, great reward, great splendour.

original: appaṭṭhamidaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ pabbajjā kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaphalaṁ hotī’ti.
analyzed: appaṭṭham idam appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham pabbajjā kammaṭṭhānam appa phalam hoti iti
translated: The performance of duties in the life of one gone forth is a small thing, with little fruit, little reward, little splendour.’

original: Idha bhavaṁ gotamo kimāhā”ti.
analyzed: bhavam gotamaḥ kim āha ati
translated: What does Master Gotama say about this?”

original: “Etthāpi kho ahaṁ, māṇava, vibhajjavādo;
analyzed: ettha api kho aha māṇava vibhajja vādaḥ
translated: “Here, student, I am one who teaches the Dhamma by distinguishing:

original: nāhamettha ekaṁsavādo.
analyzed: na aham ettha eka savādaḥ
translated: I do not teach the Dhamma by a single stereotyped formula.

original: Atthi, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ, vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti;
analyzed: atthi māṇava kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambha vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti
translated: There is, student, a performance of duties that is a great thing, with great fruit, great reward, great splendour, but when it goes to excess it is harmful.

original: atthi, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ, sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti;
analyzed: atthi māṇava kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambha sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: There is, student, a meditation subject that is great, of great fruit and great benefit, and it is successful when developed.

original: atthi, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ, vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti;
analyzed: atthi māṇava kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambha vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti
translated: There is, student, a meditation subject that is small, of small fruit and small benefit, and it is unsuccessful when developed.

original: atthi, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti.
analyzed: atthi māṇava kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: There is, student, a meditation subject that is small, of small fruit and small benefit, and it is successful when developed.

original: Katamañca, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti?🔽Kasi kho, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti.
analyzed: katamañca māṇava kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambham vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti  kasi kho māṇava kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambham vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti
translated: “And what, student, is the meditation subject that is great, of great fruit and great benefit, and it is unsuccessful when developed?🔽Agriculture, student, is a meditation subject that is great, of great fruit and great benefit, and it is unsuccessful when developed.

original: Katamañca, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti?
analyzed: katamañca māṇava kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambham sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: “And what, student, is the meditation subject that is great, of great fruit and great benefit, and it is successful when developed?

original: Kasiyeva kho, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti.
analyzed: kasiyā iva kho māṇava kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambham sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: But when agriculture is successful, it is very fruitful.

original: Katamañca, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti?
analyzed: katamañca māṇava kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti
translated: “And what, student, is the unprofitable pursuit that is unsuccessful and unfruitful?

original: Vaṇijjā kho, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti.
analyzed: vaṇijjā kho māṇava kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti
translated: Trade.

original: Katamañca, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti?
analyzed: katamañca māṇava kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: “And what, student, is the unprofitable pursuit that is successful and fruitful?

original: Vaṇijjāyeva kho, māṇava, kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti.
analyzed: vaṇijjāya iva kho māṇava kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: Trade.

original: Seyyathāpi, māṇava, kasi kammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti;
analyzed: seyyathā api māṇava kasi kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambham vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti
translated: Just as farming as a practice is of great fruit, of great result, of great splendor, of great extent, and when it fails it is of little fruit, of little result, of little splendor, and of little extent;

original: evameva kho, māṇava, gharāvāsakammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti.
analyzed: evam eva kho māṇava ghara āvāsa kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambham vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti
translated: just so, student, the practice of the household life is of great fruit, of great result, of great splendor, of great extent, and when it fails it is of little fruit, of little result, of little splendor, and of little extent.

original: Seyyathāpi, māṇava, kasiyeva kammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti;
analyzed: seyyathā api māṇava kasiyā iva kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambham sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: Just as farming as a practice is of great fruit, of great result, of great splendor, of great extent, and when it succeeds it is of great fruit, of great result, of great splendor, and of great extent;

original: evameva kho, māṇava, gharāvāsakammaṭṭhānaṁ mahaṭṭhaṁ mahākiccaṁ mahādhikaraṇaṁ mahāsamārambhaṁ sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti.
analyzed: evam eva kho māṇava ghara āvāsa kammaṭṭhānam mahaṭṭham mahā kiccam mahā adhikaraṇam mahā samārambham sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: just so, student, the practice of the household life is of great fruit, of great result, of great splendor, of great extent, and when it succeeds it is of great fruit, of great result, of great splendor, and of great extent.

original: Seyyathāpi, māṇava, vaṇijjā kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti;
analyzed: seyyathā api māṇava vaṇijjā kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti
translated: Just as trading as a practice is of little fruit, of little result, of little splendor, and of little extent, and when it fails it is of still less fruit, of still less result, of still less splendor, and of still less extent;

original: evameva kho, māṇava, pabbajjā kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ vipajjamānaṁ appaphalaṁ hoti.
analyzed: evam eva kho māṇava pabbajjā kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti
translated: In the same way, when the going forth is not practiced, not cultivated, not made much of, not made a vehicle, not made a basis, not made a support, not made a foundation, it is of no benefit.

original: Seyyathāpi, māṇava, vaṇijjāyeva kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti;
analyzed: seyyathā api māṇava vaṇijjāya iva kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti
translated: Just as when trade is practiced, cultivated, made much of, made a vehicle, made a basis, made a support, made a foundation, it is of great benefit;

original: evameva kho, māṇava, pabbajjā kammaṭṭhānaṁ appaṭṭhaṁ appakiccaṁ appādhikaraṇaṁ appasamārambhaṁ sampajjamānaṁ mahapphalaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho māṇava pabbajjā kammaṭṭhānam appaṭṭham appa kiccam appa adhikaraṇam appa samārambham sampajjamānam mahapphalam hoti iti
translated: in the same way, when the going forth is practiced, cultivated, made much of, made a vehicle, made a basis, made a support, made a foundation, it is of great benefit.”

original: “Brāhmaṇā, bho gotama, pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya, kusalassa ārādhanāyā”ti.
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ bho gotama pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya ati
translated: “Master Gotama, the brahmins prescribe five things for the performance of merit, for accomplishing the wholesome.”

original: “Ye te, māṇava, brāhmaṇā pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya, kusalassa ārādhanāya—
analyzed: ye te māṇava brāhmaṇā pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya
translated: “Student, when the brahmins prescribe these five things for the performance of merit, for accomplishing the wholesome—

original: sace te agaru—
analyzed: sace te agaru
translated: if it is not troublesome for you,

original: sādhu te pañca dhamme imasmiṁ parisati bhāsassū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu te pañca dhamme imasmin parisati bhāsassu iti
translated: it would be good if you would recite them in this assembly.”

original: “Na kho me, bho gotama, garu yatthassu bhavanto vā nisinno bhavantarūpo vā”ti.
analyzed: na khalu me bho gotama garu bhavantaḥ vā nisinnaḥ bhavantarūpaḥ vāti
translated: “It’s not hard for me to sit in the presence of the one who is either a perfected one or a person of great powers.”

original: “Tena hi, māṇava, bhāsassū”ti.
analyzed: tena hi māṇava bhāsassu iti
translated: “Well then, student, speak.”

original: “Saccaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya, kusalassa ārādhanāya.🔽Tapaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā dutiyaṁ dhammaṁ paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya, kusalassa ārādhanāya.🔽Brahmacariyaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā tatiyaṁ dhammaṁ paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya, kusalassa ārādhanāya.
analyzed: saccam kho bho gotama brāhmaṇā paṭhamam dhammam paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya  tapam kho bho gotama brāhmaṇāḥ dutiyam dhammam paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya  brahmacariyam kho bho gotama brāhmaṇāḥ tatiyam dhammam paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya
translated: “Master Gotama, brahmins proclaim the first of these principles for the performance of merit, for accomplishing the wholesome.🔽They proclaim austerity as the second principle …🔽the spiritual life as the third principle …

original: Ajjhenaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā catutthaṁ dhammaṁ paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya, kusalassa ārādhanāya.
analyzed: ajjhenam kho bho gotama brāhmaṇā catuttham dhammam paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya
translated: the sacrifice as the fourth principle …

original: Cāgaṁ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā pañcamaṁ dhammaṁ paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya, kusalassa ārādhanāya.
analyzed: cāgam kho bho gotama brāhmaṇā pañcamam dhammam paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya
translated: giving as the fifth principle for the performance of merit, for accomplishing the wholesome.

original: Brāhmaṇā, bho gotama, ime pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya, kusalassa ārādhanāyāti.
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ bho gotama ime pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya ati
translated: “Master Gotama, the brahmins prescribe these five things for the performance of merit, for accomplishing the wholesome.”

original: Idha bhavaṁ gotamo kimāhā”ti?
analyzed: bhavam gotamaḥ kim āha ati
translated: What does Master Gotama say about this?”

original: “Kiṁ pana, māṇava, atthi koci brāhmaṇānaṁ ekabrāhmaṇopi yo evamāha:
analyzed: kim pana māṇava atthi koci brāhmaṇānam eka brāhmaṇaḥ api yaḥ evam āha
translated: “But, student, is there any one brahmin who says this:

original: ‘ahaṁ imesaṁ pañcannaṁ dhammānaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākaṁ pavedemī’”ti?
analyzed: aham imesam pañcannam dhammānam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākam pavedemi iti
translated: ‘I know this, I see this: I declare the result of these five things here and now’?”

original: “No hidaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: na u hida bho gotama
translated: “No, Master Gotama.”

original: “Kiṁ pana, māṇava, atthi koci brāhmaṇānaṁ ekācariyopi ekācariyapācariyopi yāva sattamā ācariyamahayugāpi yo evamāha:
analyzed: kim pana māṇava atthi koci brāhmaṇānaṃ eka ācariyaḥ api eka ācariya pācariyaḥ api evam āha
translated: “But, student, is there any one teacher of the brahmins or his teacher’s teacher back to the seventh generation of teachers who says this:

original: ‘ahaṁ imesaṁ pañcannaṁ dhammānaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākaṁ pavedemī’”ti?
analyzed: aham imesam pañcannam dhammānam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākam pavedemi iti
translated: ‘I know this, I see this: I declare the result of these five things here and now’?”

original: “No hidaṁ, bho gotama”.🔽“Kiṁ pana, māṇava, yepi te brāhmaṇānaṁ pubbakā isayo mantānaṁ kattāro mantānaṁ pavattāro
analyzed: na u hida bho gotama  kim pana māṇava ye api te brāhmaṇānam pubbakāḥ isayaḥ mantānam kattāraḥ mantānam pavattāraḥ
translated: “No, Master Gotama.”

original: yesamidaṁ etarahi brāhmaṇā porāṇaṁ mantapadaṁ gītaṁ pavuttaṁ samihitaṁ tadanugāyanti
analyzed: yesam idam etarahi brāhmaṇā porāṇam manta padam gītam pavuttam samihitam tat anugāyanti
translated: “But, student, as to those ancient brahmin hymns that the brahmins today still chant, recite, and venerate, and which the brahmins of the past, the fathers and ancestors of those brahmins, chanted, recited, and venerated,🔽have the brahmins ever declared:

original: tadanubhāsanti bhāsitamanubhāsanti vācitamanuvācenti, seyyathidaṁ—aṭṭhako vāmako
analyzed: tat anubhāsanti bhāsitam anubhāsanti vācitam anuvācenti seyyathidaṭṭhakaḥ vāmakaḥ
translated: they repeat what was said, they repeat what was spoken, they say: ‘Aṭṭhaka, Vāmaka,

original: vāmadevo vessāmitto yamataggi aṅgīraso bhāradvājo vāseṭṭho kassapo bhagu,
analyzed: vāmadevaḥ vessāmittaḥ yamataggi aṅgīrasaḥ bhāradvājaḥ vāseṭṭhaḥ kassapaḥ bhagu
translated: Vāmadeva, Vessāmitta, Yamadaggi, Aṅgīrasa, Bhāradvāja, Vāseṭṭha, Kassapa, Bhagu,

original: tepi evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: te pi
translated: they also said this:

original: ‘mayaṁ imesaṁ pañcannaṁ dhammānaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākaṁ pavedemā’”ti?
analyzed: mayam imesam pañcannam dhammānam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākam pavedema ati
translated: ‘We declare the result of these five things by our own insight and direct knowledge.’

original: “No hidaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: na u hida bho gotama
translated: “No, Master Gotama.”

original: “Iti kira, māṇava, natthi koci brāhmaṇānaṁ ekabrāhmaṇopi yo evamāha:
analyzed: iti kira māṇava na atthi koci brāhmaṇānam eka brāhmaṇaḥ api yaḥ evam āha
translated: “So, student, it seems that there is no one among the brahmins—whether young or old, senior or junior, or of middle standing—

original: ‘ahaṁ imesaṁ pañcannaṁ dhammānaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākaṁ pavedemī’ti;
analyzed: aham imesam pañcannam dhammānam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākam pavedemi iti
translated: who says this: ‘I declare the result of these five things by my own insight and direct knowledge.’

original: natthi koci brāhmaṇānaṁ ekācariyopi ekācariyapācariyopi yāva sattamā ācariyamahayugāpi yo evamāha:
analyzed: natthi koci brāhmaṇānaṃ eka ācariyaḥ api eka ācariya pācariyaḥ api evam āha
translated: It seems that there is no one among the brahmins—whether a teacher or a teacher’s teacher back to the seventh generation of teachers—

original: ‘ahaṁ imesaṁ pañcannaṁ dhammānaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākaṁ pavedemī’ti;
analyzed: aham imesam pañcannam dhammānam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākam pavedemi iti
translated: who says this: ‘I declare the result of these five things by my own insight and direct knowledge.’

original: yepi te brāhmaṇānaṁ pubbakā isayo mantānaṁ kattāro mantānaṁ pavattāro, yesamidaṁ
analyzed: ye api te brāhmaṇānam pubbakāḥ isayaḥ mantānam kattāraḥ mantānam pavattāraḥ yesam idam
translated: It seems that even the ancient brahmin seers, the creators of the hymns, the composers of the hymns,

original: etarahi brāhmaṇā porāṇaṁ mantapadaṁ gītaṁ pavuttaṁ samihitaṁ, tadanugāyanti tadanubhāsanti
analyzed: etarahi brāhmaṇā porāṇam manta padam gītam pavuttam tat anugāyanti tat anubhāsanti
translated: Nowadays, brahmins chant and sing the verses of the ancient seers, just as they did before.🔽They repeat what was spoken and sing what was sung.

original: bhāsitamanubhāsanti vācitamanuvācenti, seyyathidaṁ—aṭṭhako vāmako vāmadevo vessāmitto
analyzed: bhāsitam anubhāsanti vācitam anuvācenti seyyathidaṭṭhakaḥ vāmakaḥ vāmadevaḥ vessāmitto
translated: They are the verses of Aṭṭhaka, Vāmaka, Vāmadeva, Vessāmitta,

original: yamataggi aṅgīraso bhāradvājo vāseṭṭho kassapo bhagu.
analyzed: yamataggi aṅgīrasaḥ bhāradvājaḥ vāseṭṭhaḥ kassapaḥ bhagu
translated: Yamataggi, Aṅgīrasa, Bhāradvāja, Vāseṭṭha, Kassapa, and Bhagu.

original: Tepi na evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: te pi naḥ evam
translated: But they don’t say,

original: ‘mayaṁ imesaṁ pañcannaṁ dhammānaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākaṁ pavedemā’ti.
analyzed: mayam imesam pañcannam dhammānam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā vipākam pavedema ati
translated: ‘We declare the result of these five things by our own mind’s knowledge.’

original: Seyyathāpi, māṇava, andhaveṇi paramparāsaṁsattā purimopi na passati majjhimopi na passati pacchimopi na passati;
analyzed: seyyathā api māṇava andhaveṇi paramparā sa sattā purimaḥ api na passati majjhimaḥ api na passati pacchimaḥ api na passati
translated: Just as a line of blind men, each holding on to the one in front, the first one sees nothing, the middle one sees nothing, and the last one sees nothing;

original: evameva kho, māṇava, andhaveṇūpamaṁ maññe brāhmaṇānaṁ bhāsitaṁ sampajjati—purimopi na passati majjhimopi na passati pacchimopi na passatī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho māṇava andha veṇu upamam maññe brāhmaṇānam bhāsitam sampajjati purimaḥ api na passati majjhimaḥ api na passati pacchimaḥ api na passati iti
translated: so it seems to me that the speech of the brahmins is like a line of blind men: the first one sees nothing, the middle one sees nothing, and the last one sees nothing.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, subho māṇavo todeyyaputto bhagavatā andhaveṇūpamena vuccamāno kupito anattamano bhagavantaṁyeva khuṁsento bhagavantaṁyeva vambhento bhagavantaṁyeva vadamāno:
analyzed: evam vutte subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya puttaḥ bhagavatā andha veṇu upamena vuccamānaḥ kupitaḥ anatta manaḥ bhagavantayā iva khusentaḥ bhagavantayā iva vambhentaḥ bhagavantayā iva vadamānaḥ
translated: When this was said, the brahmin student Subha, Todeyya’s son, angry and displeased, reproached, disturbed, and vexed, said to the Blessed One:

original: “samaṇo gotamo pāpito bhavissatī”ti bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ pāpitaḥ bhavissati iti bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: “The recluse Gotama will be sorry for this!”

original: “brāhmaṇo, bho gotama, pokkharasāti opamañño subhagavaniko evamāha:
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ bho gotama pokkharasāti opamaññaḥ subhagavanikaḥ evam āha
translated: “Master Gotama, the brahmin Pokkharasati of the Bhaggas, the one with the moving bowels, says this:

original: ‘evameva panidhekacce samaṇabrāhmaṇā uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṁ paṭijānanti.
analyzed: evam eva panidhā ikacce samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesam paṭijānanti
translated: ‘There are some recluses and brahmins who claim to teach the fundamentals of the holy life after having reached the consummation and perfection of direct knowledge here and now.

original: Tesamidaṁ bhāsitaṁ hassakaṁyeva sampajjati, nāmakaṁyeva sampajjati, rittakaṁyeva sampajjati, tucchakaṁyeva sampajjati.
analyzed: tesam idam bhāsitam hassakayā iva sampajjati nāmakayā iva sampajjati rittakayā iva sampajjati tucchakayā iva sampajjati
translated: But when they are questioned, cross-questioned, and talked to, it turns out that they are mere talkers.

original: Kathañhi nāma manussabhūto uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṁ ñassati vā dakkhati vā sacchi vā karissatīti—
analyzed: katham hi nāma manussa bhūtaḥ uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesam ñassati vā dakkhati vā sacchi vā karissati iti
translated: How can a human being know or see or reach a state beyond the present world?

original: netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjatī’”ti?
analyzed: na itam ṭhānam vijjati iti
translated: That is impossible.”

original: “Kiṁ pana, māṇava, brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti opamañño subhagavaniko sabbesaṁyeva samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ cetasā ceto paricca pajānātī”ti?
analyzed: kim pana māṇava brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti opamaññaḥ subhagavaniko sabbesayā iva samaṇa brāhmaṇānam cetasā cetaḥ paricca pajānāti iti
translated: “But, student, does Pokkharasati know the minds of all recluses and brahmins, encompassing all with his awareness?”

original: “Sakāyapi hi, bho gotama, puṇṇikāya dāsiyā brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti opamañño subhagavaniko🔽cetasā ceto paricca na pajānāti, kuto pana sabbesaṁyeva samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ cetasā
analyzed: hi bho gotama puṇṇikāya dāsiyā brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti opamaññaḥ subhaga vanikaḥ  cetasā cetaḥ paricca na pajānāti kutas pana sabbesayā iva samaṇa brāhmaṇānam cetasā
translated: “Master Gotama, Pokkharasati does not even know the mind of his own slave Punna,

original: ceto paricca pajānissatī”ti?
analyzed: cetaḥ paricca pajānissati iti
translated: let alone the minds of all recluses and brahmins.”

original: “Seyyathāpi, māṇava, jaccandho puriso na passeyya kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni, na passeyya
analyzed: seyyathā api māṇava jat candho purisaḥ na passeyya kaṇha sukkāni rūpāni na passeyya
translated: “Student, it is just as if a man blind from birth were to say:

original: nīlakāni rūpāni, na passeyya pītakāni rūpāni, na passeyya lohitakāni rūpāni, na passeyya
analyzed: nīlakāni rūpāni na passeyya pītakāni rūpāni na passeyya lohitakāni rūpāni na passeyya
translated: ‘I do not see dark and light colours, I do not see blue, yellow, red, or pink;

original: mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni, na passeyya samavisamaṁ, na passeyya tārakarūpāni, na passeyya candimasūriye.🔽So evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni na passeyya sama visama na passeyya tāraka rūpāni na passeyya candima sūriye  saḥ u evam vadeyya
translated: I do not see what is even and uneven; I do not see stars or the sun and moon.

original: ‘natthi kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni, natthi kaṇhasukkānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;
analyzed: na atthi kaṇha sukkāni rūpāni na atthi kaṇha sukkānam rūpānam dassāvī
translated: Therefore there are no dark and light colours, there is no one who sees dark and light colours;

original: natthi nīlakāni rūpāni, natthi nīlakānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;
analyzed: natthi nīlakāni rūpāni natthi nīlakānam rūpānam dassāvī
translated: There are no blue things, there is no one who sees blue things;

original: natthi pītakāni rūpāni, natthi pītakānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;🔽natthi lohitakāni rūpāni, natthi lohitakānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;
analyzed: natthi pītakāni rūpāni natthi pītakānam rūpānam dassāvī  na atthi lohitakāni rūpāni na atthi lohitakānam rūpānam dassāvī
translated: there are no yellow things, there is no one who sees yellow things;🔽there are no red things, there is no one who sees red things;

original: natthi mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni, natthi mañjiṭṭhakānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;🔽natthi samavisamaṁ, natthi samavisamassa dassāvī;
analyzed: natthi mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni natthi mañjiṭṭhakānam rūpānam dassāvī  natthi sama visama natthi sama visamassa dassāvī
translated: there are no orange things, there is no one who sees orange things;🔽there is no high, there is no one who sees high;

original: natthi tārakarūpāni, natthi tārakarūpānaṁ dassāvī;
analyzed: na atthi tāraka rūpāni na atthi tāraka rūpānam dassāvī
translated: there are no stars, there is no one who sees stars;

original: natthi candimasūriyā, natthi candimasūriyānaṁ dassāvī.
analyzed: na atthi candima sūriyāḥ na atthi candima sūriyānam dassāvī
translated: there are no moon and sun, there is no one who sees the moon and sun.

original: Ahametaṁ na jānāmi, ahametaṁ na passāmi;
analyzed: aham etam na jānāmi aham etam na passāmi
translated: I don’t know that, I don’t see that.

original: tasmā taṁ natthī’ti.
analyzed: tasmāt tam natthi iti
translated: Therefore it doesn’t exist.’

original: Sammā nu kho so, māṇava, vadamāno vadeyyā”ti?
analyzed: sammā nu kho saḥ māṇava vadamānaḥ vadeyya iti
translated: Would he be speaking rightly?”

original: “No hidaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Atthi kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni, atthi kaṇhasukkānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;
analyzed: na u hida bho gotama  atthi kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni atthi kaṇhasukkānam rūpānam dassāvī
translated: “No, Master Gotama.🔽There are dark and bright things, there is one who sees dark and bright things;

original: atthi nīlakāni rūpāni, atthi nīlakānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;
analyzed: atthi nīlakāni rūpāni atthi nīlakānam rūpānam dassāvī
translated: there are blue things, there is one who sees blue things;

original: atthi pītakāni rūpāni, atthi pītakānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;🔽atthi lohitakāni rūpāni, atthi lohitakānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;
analyzed: atthi pītakāni rūpāni atthi pītakānam rūpānam dassāvī  atthi lohitakāni rūpāni atthi lohitakānam rūpānam dassāvī
translated: There are yellow things, and someone who sees yellow things;🔽there are red things, and someone who sees red things;

original: atthi mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni, atthi mañjiṭṭhakānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassāvī;🔽atthi samavisamaṁ, atthi samavisamassa dassāvī;
analyzed: atthi mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni atthi mañjiṭṭhakānam rūpānam dassāvī  atthi sama visama atthi sama visamassa dassāvī
translated: there are magenta things, and someone who sees magenta things;🔽there are uneven things, and someone who sees uneven things;

original: atthi tārakarūpāni, atthi tārakarūpānaṁ dassāvī;
analyzed: atthi tāraka rūpāni atthi tāraka rūpānam dassāvī
translated: there are the stars, and someone who sees the stars;

original: atthi candimasūriyā, atthi candimasūriyānaṁ dassāvī.
analyzed: atthi candima sūriyāḥ atthi candima sūriyānam dassāvī
translated: there are the sun and moon, and someone who sees the sun and moon.

original: ‘Ahametaṁ na jānāmi, ahametaṁ na passāmi;
analyzed: aham etam na jānāmi aham etam na passāmi
translated: ‘I don’t know or see that,

original: tasmā taṁ natthī’ti;
analyzed: tasmāt tam natthi iti
translated: so it doesn’t exist.’

original: na hi so, bho gotama, sammā vadamāno vadeyyā”ti.
analyzed: na hi saḥ bho gotama sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyyā iti
translated: For he who speaks thus would not be speaking correctly.”

original: “Evameva kho, māṇava, brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti opamañño subhagavaniko andho acakkhuko.
analyzed: evam eva kho māṇava brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti opamaññaḥ subhaga vanikaḥ andhaḥ acakkhukaḥ
translated: “In the same way, student, Pokkharasāti is blind and has no eyes.

original: So vata uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṁ ñassati vā dakkhati vā sacchi vā karissatīti—netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: saḥ vata uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesam ñassati vā dakkhati vā sacchi vā karissati iti na etam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: It’s impossible for him to know or see or realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, māṇava,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi māṇava
translated: What do you think, student?

original: ye te kosalakā brāhmaṇamahāsālā, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: ye te kosalakāḥ brāhmaṇa mahā sālā
translated: the wealthy brahmins of Kosala, such as

original: caṅkī brāhmaṇo tārukkho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti brāhmaṇo jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo pitā ca te todeyyo, katamā nesaṁ seyyo, yaṁ vā te sammuccā vācaṁ bhāseyyuṁ yaṁ vā asammuccā”ti?
analyzed: caṅkī brāhmaṇo tārukkhaḥ brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti brāhmaṇo jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo pitā ca te todeyyaḥ katamā na īsam seyyaḥ yam vā te sammuccā vācam bhāseyyum yam vā a sammucca ati
translated: Caṅkī, Tārukkha, Pokkharasāti, and your own father, who is the brahmin of the brahmins, who is twice-born, who has the mark of a true brahmin—which is better, to speak with their consent or without their consent?”

original: “Sammuccā, bho gotama”.
analyzed: sammuccā bho gotama
translated: “With their consent, Master Gotama.”

original: “Katamā nesaṁ seyyo, yaṁ vā te mantā vācaṁ bhāseyyuṁ yaṁ vā amantā”ti?
analyzed: katamā seyyaḥ yam vā te mantā vācam bhāseyyum yam vai amanta ati
translated: “Which is better, to speak with their approval or without their approval?”

original: “Mantā, bho gotama”.
analyzed: mantā bho gotama
translated: “With their approval, Master Gotama.”

original: “Katamā nesaṁ seyyo, yaṁ vā te paṭisaṅkhāya vācaṁ bhāseyyuṁ yaṁ vā appaṭisaṅkhāyā”ti?
analyzed: katamā na īsam seyyaḥ yam vā te paṭisaṅkhāya vācam bhāseyyum yam vā a paṭisaṅkhāya ati
translated: “Which is better, to speak after reflection or without reflection?”

original: “Paṭisaṅkhāya, bho gotama”.
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāya bho gotama
translated: “After reflection, Master Gotama.”

original: “Katamā nesaṁ seyyo, yaṁ vā te atthasaṁhitaṁ vācaṁ bhāseyyuṁ yaṁ vā anatthasaṁhitan”ti?
analyzed: katamā na īsam seyyaḥ yam vā te attha sahitam vācam bhāseyyum yam vā anattha sahitam ti
translated: “Which is better, to speak what is beneficial or what is unbeneficial?”

original: “Atthasaṁhitaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: attha sahita bho gotama
translated: “What is beneficial, Master Gotama.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, māṇava,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi māṇava
translated: “What do you think, student?

original: yadi evaṁ sante, brāhmaṇena pokkharasātinā opamaññena subhagavanikena sammuccā vācā bhāsitā asammuccā”ti?
analyzed: yadi evam sante brāhmaṇena pokkharasātinā opamaññena subhagavanikena sammuccā vācā bhāsitā a sammucca ati
translated: If that is so, is the speech of Pokkharasāti the brahmin of the brahmins, who is twice-born, who has the mark of a true brahmin, better or worse?”

original: “Asammuccā, bho gotama”.
analyzed: asammuccā bho gotama
translated: “Without permission, Master Gotama.”

original: “Mantā vācā bhāsitā amantā vā”ti?
analyzed: mantā vācā bhāsitā amantā vāti
translated: “Was the speech you spoke premeditated or unpremeditated?”

original: “Amantā, bho gotama”.
analyzed: amantā bho gotama
translated: “Unpremeditated, Master Gotama.”

original: “Paṭisaṅkhāya vācā bhāsitā appaṭisaṅkhāyā”ti?
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāya vācā bhāsitā a paṭisaṅkhāya ati
translated: “Was the speech you spoke after reflection or without reflection?”

original: “Appaṭisaṅkhāya, bho gotama”.
analyzed: appaṭisaṅkhāya bho gotama
translated: “Without reflection, Master Gotama.”

original: “Atthasaṁhitā vācā bhāsitā anatthasaṁhitā”ti?
analyzed: attha sahitā vācā bhāsitā anattha sahitā ati
translated: “Was the speech you spoke beneficial or unbeneficial?”

original: “Anatthasaṁhitā, bho gotama”.
analyzed: anattha sahitā bho gotama
translated: “Unbeneficial, Master Gotama.”

original: “Pañca kho ime, māṇava, nīvaraṇā.
analyzed: pañca kho ime māṇava nīvaraṇā
translated: “Student, there are these five hindrances.

original: Katame pañca?

original: Yaṁ taṁ kusalūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ, cittassāhaṁ etaṁ parikkhāraṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: yam tam kusalūpa sahitam pāmojja cittassa aham etam parikkhāram vadāmi
translated: The joy connected with what is skillful, I say, is a requisite for the development of awareness.

original: yadidaṁ cittaṁ averaṁ abyābajjhaṁ tassa bhāvanāya.
analyzed: yat idam cittam averam a byābajjham tassa bhāvanāya
translated: It’s for the sake of developing awareness free from enmity & aversion.

original: Ye te, māṇava, brāhmaṇā pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya, cittassāhaṁ ete parikkhāre vadāmi—
analyzed: ye te māṇava brāhmaṇā pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya cittassa aham ete parikkhāre vadāmi
translated: “Those brahmans who prescribe the five austerities for the performance of merit, for the performance of what is skillful, for the realization of what has not been realized, for the growth, increase, & abundance of what has been realized—I say that the development of awareness is a requisite for the performance of merit, for the performance of what is skillful, for the realization of what has not been realized, for the growth, increase, & abundance of what has been realized.

original: yadidaṁ cittaṁ averaṁ abyābajjhaṁ tassa bhāvanāyā”ti.
analyzed: yat idam cittam averam a byābajjham tassa bhāvanāya ati
translated: It’s for the sake of developing awareness free from enmity & aversion.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, subho māṇavo todeyyaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Subha, the brahmin student of the Toṇḍa tribe, said to the Blessed One,🔽“Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent!

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho gotama:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bho gotama
translated: “I have heard this, Master Gotama:

original: ‘samaṇo gotamo brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggaṁ jānātī’”ti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ brahmānam sahabyatāya maggam jānāti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama knows the path to union with Brahmā.’

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, māṇava,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi māṇava
translated: “What do you think, student?

original: āsanne ito naḷakāragāmo, na yito dūre naḷakāragāmo”ti?
analyzed: āsanne itas naḷakāragāmaḥ na dūre
translated: Is the village of Nālaka near here, not far from here?”

original: “Evaṁ, bho, āsanne ito naḷakāragāmo, na yito dūre naḷakāragāmo”ti.
analyzed: eva bho āsanne itas naḷakāragāmaḥ na dūre
translated: “Yes, sir, the village of Nālaka is near here, not far from here.”

original: “Taṁ, kiṁ maññasi, māṇava, idhassa puriso naḷakāragāme jātavaddho;
analyzed: ta kim maññasi māṇava idhassa purisaḥ naḷakāra gāme jāta vaddhaḥ
translated: “What do you think, student? Suppose a man were born and raised in the village of Nālaka

original: tamenaṁ naḷakāragāmato tāvadeva avasaṭaṁ naḷakāragāmassa maggaṁ puccheyyuṁ;
analyzed: tam enam naḷakāra gāmataḥ tāvat eva avasaṭam naḷakāra gāmassa maggam puccheyyu
translated: and then, after a long absence, he were to return to the village of Nālaka.

original: siyā nu kho, māṇava, tassa purisassa naḷakāragāme jātavaddhassa naḷakāragāmassa maggaṁ puṭṭhassa dandhāyitattaṁ vā vitthāyitattaṁ vā”ti?
analyzed: siyā nu kho māṇava tassa purisassa naḷakāra gāme jātavaddhassa naḷakāra gāmassa maggam puṭṭhassa dandhāyi tattam vā vitthāyi tattam vā ati
translated: If they asked him about the paths in the village of Nālaka, would he hesitate to answer?”

original: “No hidaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: na u hida bho gotama
translated: “No, Master Gotama.”

original: “Taṁ kissa hetu”?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: “And why not?”

original: “Amu hi, bho gotama, puriso naḷakāragāme jātavaddho. Tassa sabbāneva naḷakāragāmassa maggāni suviditānī”ti.
analyzed: amu hi bho gotama purisaḥ naḷakāra gāme jāta vaddhaḥ tassa sabbāna eva naḷakāra gāmassa maggāni su viditāni iti
translated: “Because that man was born and raised in the village of Nālaka. He knows all the paths in the village of Nālaka.”

original: “Siyā nu kho, māṇava, tassa purisassa naḷakāragāme jātavaddhassa naḷakāragāmassa🔽maggaṁ puṭṭhassa dandhāyitattaṁ vā vitthāyitattaṁ vāti, na tveva tathāgatassa brahmalokaṁ
analyzed: siyā nu kho māṇava tassa purisassa naḷakāra gāme jātavaddhassa naḷakāra gāmassa  maggam puṭṭhassa dandhāyi tattam vā vitthāyi tattam vā ati na tu eva tathāgatassa brahma loka
translated: “It’s possible that when asked about the path to the village of Nalakara, he would hesitate or falter.

original: vā brahmalokagāminiṁ vā paṭipadaṁ puṭṭhassa dandhāyitattaṁ vā vitthāyitattaṁ vā.
analyzed: vā brahma loka gāminim vā paṭipadam puṭṭhassa dandhāyi tattam vā vitthāyi tattam vā
translated: But when asked about the world of Brahma or the path that leads to the world of Brahma, the Tathāgata would not hesitate or falter.

original: Brahmānañcāhaṁ, māṇava, pajānāmi brahmalokañca brahmalokagāminiñca paṭipadaṁ; yathāpaṭipanno ca brahmalokaṁ upapanno tañca pajānāmī”ti.
analyzed: brahmānam ca āha māṇava pajānāmi brahma lokañca brahma loka gāminim ca paṭipada yathā paṭipannaḥ ca brahma lokam upapannaḥ tat ca pajānāmi iti
translated: I understand Brahma, the world of Brahma, and the path that leads to the world of Brahma. I understand how one who has entered this path will reappear in the world of Brahma.”

original: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bho gotama:🔽‘samaṇo gotamo brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggaṁ desetī’ti.
analyzed: sutam mā ita bho gotama  samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ brahmānam sahabyatāya maggam deseti iti
translated: “Master Gotama, I have heard that🔽you teach a path to union with Brahma.

original: Sādhu me bhavaṁ gotamo brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggaṁ desetū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu me bhavam gotamaḥ brahmānam sahabyatāya maggam desetu uti
translated: It would be good if Master Gotama would teach me that path to union with Brahma.”

original: “Tena hi, māṇava, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi māṇava suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Well then, student, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho subho māṇavo todeyyaputto bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya putto bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Subha replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Katamo ca, māṇava, brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca māṇava brahmānam sahabyatāya maggo
translated: “And what, student, is the path and way to companionship with Brahma?

original: Idha, māṇava, bhikkhu mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā🔽dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ, tathā catutthaṁ; iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya
analyzed: idha māṇava bhikkhu mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā  tathā tatiya tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya
translated: Here, a bhikkhu abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth;

original: sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena🔽abyābajjhena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: sabbāvantam lokam mettā sahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena  a byābajjhena pharitvā viharati
translated: so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abides pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: Evaṁ bhāvitāya kho, māṇava, mettāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evam bhāvitāya kho māṇava mettāya cetaḥ vimuttiyāḥ yam pamāṇa katam kammam na tam tatra avasissati na tam tatra avatiṭṭhati
translated: When the liberation of mind by loving-kindness is developed in this way, no limiting action remains there, none persists there.

original: Seyyathāpi, māṇava, balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasireneva cātuddisā viññāpeyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api māṇava balavā saṅkha dhamaḥ appa kasirena iva cātuddisā viññāpeyya
translated: Just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm, so too, in regard to any of these directions, the devas know: ‘This one is here,’ and the bhikkhu knows: ‘This one is here.’

original: evameva kho, māṇava …pe… evaṁ bhāvitāya kho, māṇava, mettāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evam eva kho māṇava pe evam bhāvitāya kho māṇava mettāya cetaḥ vimuttiyāḥ yam pamāṇa katam kammam na tam tatra avasissati na tam tatra avatiṭṭhati
translated: So too, when the liberation of mind by loving-kindness is developed in this way, no limiting action remains there, none persists there.

original: Ayampi kho, māṇava, brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggo.
analyzed: ayam pi kho māṇava brahmānam sahabya tāya maggaḥ
translated: This is the path, the way to companionship with Brahma.

original: “Puna caparaṁ, māṇava, bhikkhu karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
analyzed: puna capara māṇava bhikkhu karuṇā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: “Again, a bhikkhu abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with compassion…

original: muditāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
analyzed: muditā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: with a mind imbued with appreciative joy…

original: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ,🔽tathā catutthaṁ; iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā dutiya tathā tatiya  tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam upekkhā sahagatena
translated: with a mind imbued with equanimity, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth;

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā viharati
translated: so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abides pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with equanimity, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: Evaṁ bhāvitāya kho, māṇava, upekkhāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evam bhāvitāya kho māṇava upekkhāya cetaḥ vimuttiyā yam pamāṇa katam kammam na tam tatra avasissati na tam tatra avatiṭṭhati
translated: When the liberation of mind by equanimity has been developed in this way, no limiting action remains there, none persists there.

original: Seyyathāpi, māṇava, balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasireneva cātuddisā viññāpeyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api māṇava balavā saṅkha dhamaḥ appa kasirena iva cātuddisā viññāpeyya
translated: Suppose, student, a strong man were to blow through a thighbone trumpet;

original: evameva kho, māṇava …pe… evaṁ bhāvitāya kho, māṇava, upekkhāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evam eva kho māṇava pe evam bhāvitāya kho māṇava upekkhāya cetas vimuttiyā yam pamāṇa katam kammam na tam tatra avasissati na tam tatra avatiṭṭhati
translated: So too, student, when the liberation of mind by equanimity has been developed in this way, whatever action he performs with his body…

original: Ayampi kho, māṇava, brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggo”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi khalu māṇava brahmānam sahabyatāya maggoti
translated: This is the path, student, to union with Brahma.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, subho māṇavo todeyyaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Subha, Todeyya’s son, said to the Blessed One:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama  seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent, Master Gotama!

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Master Gotama has made the Dhamma clear in many ways, as though he were turning upright what had been overthrown, revealing what was hidden, showing the way to one who was lost, or holding up a lamp in the dark for those with eyesight to see forms.

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: So too, Master Gotama has made the Dhamma clear in many ways.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to Master Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gataṁ.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gata
translated: May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”

original: Handa ca dāni mayaṁ, bho gotama, gacchāma;
analyzed: handa ca dāni maya bho gotama gacchāma
translated: Now, Gotama, we must go.

original: bahukiccā mayaṁ bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: bahu kitcā mayam bahu karaṇīyā ati
translated: We have many duties, we have much to do.”

original: “Yassadāni tvaṁ, māṇava, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni tva māṇava kālam maññasi iti
translated: “Now is the time, student, to do as you think fit.”

original: Atha kho subho māṇavo todeyyaputto bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya puttaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: Then Subha, the young brāhmaṇa, having delighted and rejoiced in the words of the Fortunate One, rising from his seat, worshipping and circumambulating the Fortunate One, went away.

original: Tena kho pana samayena jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo sabbasetena vaḷavābhirathena sāvatthiyā niyyāti divā divassa.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ sabba setena vaḷava abhirathena sāvatthiyā niyyāti divā divassa
translated: Then at that time the brāhmaṇa Jāṇussoṇi was going out from Sāvatthī in the middle of the day in a chariot that was completely covered in white.

original: Addasā kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo subhaṁ māṇavaṁ todeyyaputtaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ subham māṇavam todeyya puttam dūratas vā āgacchanta
translated: The brāhmaṇa Jāṇussoṇi saw Subha, the young brāhmaṇa, coming in the distance,

original: Disvāna subhaṁ māṇavaṁ todeyyaputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvāna subham māṇavam todeyya puttam etat avoca
translated: and after seeing (him), he said this to Subha, the young brāhmaṇa:

original: “handa kuto nu bhavaṁ bhāradvājo āgacchati divā divassā”ti?
analyzed: handa kutas nu bhavam bhāradvājaḥ āgacchati divā divassāti
translated: “Now, where is master Bhāradvāja coming from in the middle of the day?”

original: “Ito hi kho ahaṁ, bho, āgacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa santikā”ti.
analyzed: itas hi kho aha bho āgacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa santikā ati
translated: “From the presence of the ascetic Gotama, good sir, I am coming.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, bhavaṁ bhāradvājo samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyaṁ paṇḍito maññeti”?
analyzed: tam kim maññasi bhavam bhāradvājaḥ samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyam paṇḍitaḥ maññeti
translated: “What do you think, Bhāradvāja? Do you consider the ascetic Gotama to be wise?”

original: “Ko cāhaṁ, bho, ko ca samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyaṁ jānissāmi?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āha bho kaḥ ca samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyam jānissāmi
translated: “How could I know whether the ascetic Gotama is wise?

original: Sopi nūnassa tādisova yo samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyaṁ jāneyyā”ti.
analyzed: saḥ api nūna ssa tādisaḥ uva yaḥ samaṇassa gotamassa jāneyya ati
translated: Only someone who knows the ascetic Gotama’s wisdom can say whether he is wise.”

original: “Uḷārāya khalu bhavaṁ bhāradvājo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pasaṁsāya pasaṁsatī”ti.
analyzed: uḷārāya khalu bhavam bhāradvājaḥ samaṇam gotamam pasasāya pasasati iti
translated: “You praise the ascetic Gotama with high praise indeed.”

original: “Ko cāhaṁ, bho, ko ca samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pasaṁsissāmi?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āha bho kaḥ ca samaṇam gotamam pasasissāmi
translated: “How could I praise the ascetic Gotama?

original: Pasatthapasatthova so bhavaṁ gotamo seṭṭho devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: pasattha pasatthaḥ uva saḥ bhavam gotamo seṭṭhaḥ deva manussāna
translated: He is praised by those worthy of praise, the best of gods and humans.

original: Ye cime, bho, brāhmaṇā pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya;
analyzed: ye cime bho brāhmaṇā pañca dhamme paññapenti puññassa kiriyāya kusalassa ārādhanāya
translated: “Bhāradvāja, those brahmins who prescribe the five factors

original: cittassete samaṇo gotamo parikkhāre vadeti—
analyzed: cittassa ete samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ parikkhāre vadeti
translated: are simply describing the requisites of the mind.

original: yadidaṁ cittaṁ averaṁ abyābajjhaṁ tassa bhāvanāyā”ti.
analyzed: yat idam cittam averam a byābajjham tassa bhāvanāya ati
translated: The development of a mind free from enmity and ill will is the best of them.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo sabbasetā vaḷavābhirathā orohitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: evam vutte jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ sabba setā vaḷava abhirathā orohitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā udānam udānesi
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Janussoni descended from the chariot, and arranging his upper robe on one shoulder, he extended his hands in reverential salutation towards the Blessed One and exclaimed:

original: “lābhā rañño pasenadissa kosalassa, suladdhalābhā rañño pasenadissa kosalassa🔽yassa vijite tathāgato viharati arahaṁ sammāsambuddho”ti.
analyzed: lābhāḥ raññaḥ pasenadissa kosalassa su laddha lābhāḥ raññaḥ pasenadissa kosalassa  yassa vijite tathāgataḥ viharati araham sammāsambuddhaḥ ti
translated: “It is a gain for King Pasenadi of Kosala, it is a great gain for King Pasenadi of Kosala

original: Subhasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: subha suttam niṭṭhitam navama
translated: that in his realm the Tathagata, accomplished and fully enlightened, lives his life devoted to encouraging, developing, and nourishing faith.”🔽The Ninth Portion for Repeating is finished.
